On August 31, The U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) extended several flexibilities through as late as December 31, 2020. The flexibilities allow summer meal program operators to continue serving free meals into the fall months. This unprecedented move will help ensure – no matter what the situation is on-the-ground – children have access to nutritious food as the country recovers from the COVID-19 pandemic.

This extension means that USD 250 will be able to provide all enrolled students free breakfast and lunch starting today, Tuesday, September 8, 2020.

-Currently: Online enrollment at usd250.org/dragonenroll

-Currently: Free/Reduced Lunch Application at myschoolapps.com

-August 7: Remote Learning Application Due

-Prior to the Beginning of School: All immunizations and boosters must be up to date

Pittsburg USD 250 Foundation
March 21 at 1:39 AM ·

Our mission is to raise money for teacher grants, student scholarships, and enhancement of school facilities. The highlight of the year is awarding scholarships to our seniors.

Last Sunday, we should have been celebrating the Pitzer Family Scholarship Banquet with 50 seniors, their families, and the donors who provide the scholarships — we awarded more than $51,000 this year! The COVID19 pandemic meant canceling that celebration.

But we're determined to recognize these students, their families, and the scholarship donors, so we're holding a Virtual Foundation Scholarship Banquet here. Over the next few weeks, we will highlight each of them!

We hope you'll follow along and get to know our seniors and the Foundation scholarships that will help them achieve their dreams.

We are living in uncertain times right now, but these extraordinary young people fill us with hope...and Dragon Pride!

#PHSDragons2020 💜

6th Grade students were welcomed back to Earth Science with two rock experiments, but only one of them was edible.

Wrapping up their minerals and rocks unit students journey through the rock cycle in two different labs, "Science Rocks!" and "Sweet Science!", by being given minerals (crayons & starburst) and using hands-on to experience the paths and processes minerals go through in the rock cycle.

Students applied different forces that occur on earth and produced each of the three major types of rock found on our planet. Throughout the labs the students applied weathering, erosion, compaction to create sedimentary rocks. They then applied pressure and heat to create metamorphic rocks. Finally, students applied high heat to replicate volcanic activity to create igneous rock.

Mr. O'Ferrel says these are two of his favorite labs. We can see why!

#DragonExcellence #PCMSProud

The project goes along with our Dragon Word of the Month, Empathy, and a growth mindset. Students had to earn money doing chores at home and with that money went shopping for items to place in stockings that were given to the residents.

Students also made fleece blankets that they cut and tied together. We presented all these items, along with letters, to the home and caroled for the residents.

We are so proud of these Dragons!
#DragonExcellence #Empathy #CommunityPartnerships

📢 SENIORS 📢

Pittsburg State University will be joining us for the Pittsburg vs Olathe East Varsity Football game to celebrate Senior Night. We are excited to announce that they will be giving away 2, $1,000 scholarships.

Senior students, parents or guardians should visit the PSU table and complete an information card that we will be used to draw 2 senior names. This drawing will take place with 3:00 minutes left in the first half, entries must be completed prior.

If the Senior is involved in an activity during the game (ex: Band/football/media), it is perfectly acceptable to send a parent or guardian to sign up for the student.

GUS will award both scholarships on the field during halftime. There are no requirements for these scholarships, just that they attend Pitt State. Good Luck, Dragons!

Students and staff are encouraged to park in the Southeast section of the East parking lot or in the South parking lot.

All accessibility will be limited to the main drive entrance in the front of the school (on 4th Street).

All operations will return to normal on Wednesday, October 9, 2019. Thank you for your cooperation and patience during this time.
